intro: Souroubea guianensis var. bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia souroubea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
